trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage how users access your Azure Storage resources.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage how users access your Azure Storage resources.

trans-unit.source: Manage Access to Azure Storage Resources
trans-unit.target: Manage Access to Azure Storage Resources

trans-unit.source: By default, only the owner of the storage account may access storage resources within that account.
trans-unit.target: By default, only the owner of the storage account may access storage resources within that account.

trans-unit.source: If your service or application needs to make these resources available to other clients without sharing your access key, you have the following options for permitting access:
trans-unit.target: If your service or application needs to make these resources available to other clients without sharing your access key, you have the following options for permitting access:

trans-unit.source: You can set a container's permissions to permit anonymous read access to the container and its blobs.
trans-unit.target: You can set a container's permissions to permit anonymous read access to the container and its blobs.

trans-unit.source: Anonymous read access is available only for containers and blobs.
trans-unit.target: Anonymous read access is available only for containers and blobs.

trans-unit.source: You can expose a resource via a shared access signature, which enables you to delegate restricted access to a container, blob, table, queue, file share, or file by specifying the interval for which the resources are available and the permissions that a client will have to it.
trans-unit.target: You can expose a resource via a shared access signature, which enables you to delegate restricted access to a container, blob, table, queue, file share, or file by specifying the interval for which the resources are available and the permissions that a client will have to it.

trans-unit.source: You can use a stored access policy to manage shared access signatures for a container or its blobs, for a queue, for a table, or for a file share or its files.
trans-unit.target: You can use a stored access policy to manage shared access signatures for a container or its blobs, for a queue, for a table, or for a file share or its files.

trans-unit.source: The stored access policy gives you an additional measure of control over your shared access signatures and also provides a straightforward means to revoke them.
trans-unit.target: The stored access policy gives you an additional measure of control over your shared access signatures and also provides a straightforward means to revoke them.

trans-unit.source: Restrict Access to Containers and Blobs
trans-unit.target: Restrict Access to Containers and Blobs

trans-unit.source: By default, a container and any blobs within it may be accessed only by the owner of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: By default, a container and any blobs within it may be accessed only by the owner of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: To give anonymous users read permissions to a container and its blobs, you can set the container permissions to allow public access.
trans-unit.target: To give anonymous users read permissions to a container and its blobs, you can set the container permissions to allow public access.

trans-unit.source: Anonymous users can read blobs within a publicly accessible container without authenticating the request.
trans-unit.target: Anonymous users can read blobs within a publicly accessible container without authenticating the request.

trans-unit.source: Containers provide the following options for managing container access:
trans-unit.target: Containers provide the following options for managing container access:

trans-unit.source: Full public read access: Container and blob data can be read via anonymous request.
trans-unit.target: Full public read access: Container and blob data can be read via anonymous request.

trans-unit.source: Clients can enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request, but cannot enumerate containers within the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Clients can enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request, but cannot enumerate containers within the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Public read access for blobs only: Blob data within this container can be read via anonymous request, but container data is not available.
trans-unit.target: Public read access for blobs only: Blob data within this container can be read via anonymous request, but container data is not available.

trans-unit.source: Clients cannot enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request.
trans-unit.target: Clients cannot enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request.

trans-unit.source: No public read access: Container and blob data can be read by the account owner only.
trans-unit.target: No public read access: Container and blob data can be read by the account owner only.

trans-unit.source: If your service requires that you exercise more granular control over blob resources, or if you wish to provide permissions for operations other than read operations, you can use a Shared Access Signature to make a resource accessible to users.
trans-unit.target: If your service requires that you exercise more granular control over blob resources, or if you wish to provide permissions for operations other than read operations, you can use a Shared Access Signature to make a resource accessible to users.

trans-unit.source: Create and Use a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Create and Use a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature (SAS) is a URI that grants restricted access rights to a storage resource for a specified time interval.
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature (SAS) is a URI that grants restricted access rights to a storage resource for a specified time interval.

trans-unit.source: You can create a SAS on these storage resources:
trans-unit.target: You can create a SAS on these storage resources:

trans-unit.source: By providing a client with a shared access signature, you can enable them to access resources in your storage account without sharing your account key with them.
trans-unit.target: By providing a client with a shared access signature, you can enable them to access resources in your storage account without sharing your account key with them.

trans-unit.source: For an in-depth conceptual overview and tutorial on shared access signatures, see <link><linkText>Shared Access Signatures</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For an in-depth conceptual overview and tutorial on shared access signatures, see <link><linkText>Shared Access Signatures</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The shared access signature URI query parameters incorporate all of the information necessary to grant controlled access to a storage resource.
trans-unit.target: The shared access signature URI query parameters incorporate all of the information necessary to grant controlled access to a storage resource.

trans-unit.source: The URI query parameters on a SAS include the time interval over which the shared access signature is valid, the permissions that it grants, the resource that is to be made available, the version to use to execute the request, and the signature that the storage services will use to authenticate the request.
trans-unit.target: The URI query parameters on a SAS include the time interval over which the shared access signature is valid, the permissions that it grants, the resource that is to be made available, the version to use to execute the request, and the signature that the storage services will use to authenticate the request.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the shared access signature URI can reference a stored access policy that provides an additional level of control over a set of signatures, including the ability to modify or revoke access to the resource if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the shared access signature URI can reference a stored access policy that provides an additional level of control over a set of signatures, including the ability to modify or revoke access to the resource if necessary.

trans-unit.source: For information on the URI format of a shared access signature, see <link><linkText>Delegating Access with a Shared Access Signature</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on the URI format of a shared access signature, see <link><linkText>Delegating Access with a Shared Access Signature</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Secure use of Shared Access Signatures
trans-unit.target: Secure use of Shared Access Signatures

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature grants access to the resource specified by the URI's granted permissions.
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature grants access to the resource specified by the URI's granted permissions.

trans-unit.source: You should always use HTTPS to construct a shared access signature URI.
trans-unit.target: You should always use HTTPS to construct a shared access signature URI.

trans-unit.source: Using HTTP with shared access signatures can make your storage account vulnerable to malicious use.
trans-unit.target: Using HTTP with shared access signatures can make your storage account vulnerable to malicious use.

trans-unit.source: If a shared access signature grants access that is not intended for the general public, then it should be constructed with the fewest possible permissions.
trans-unit.target: If a shared access signature grants access that is not intended for the general public, then it should be constructed with the fewest possible permissions.

trans-unit.source: In addition, a shared access signature should be distributed securely to clients over a secure connection, should be associated with a stored access policy for the purpose of revocation, and should specify the shortest possible lifetime for the signature.
trans-unit.target: In addition, a shared access signature should be distributed securely to clients over a secure connection, should be associated with a stored access policy for the purpose of revocation, and should specify the shortest possible lifetime for the signature.

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature URI is associated with the account key used to create the signature, and the associated stored access policy (if any).
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature URI is associated with the account key used to create the signature, and the associated stored access policy (if any).

trans-unit.source: If no stored access policy is specified, the only way to revoke a shared access signature is to change the account key.
trans-unit.target: If no stored access policy is specified, the only way to revoke a shared access signature is to change the account key.

trans-unit.source: A stored access policy provides an additional level of control over shared access signatures on the server side.
trans-unit.target: A stored access policy provides an additional level of control over shared access signatures on the server side.

trans-unit.source: Establishing a stored access policy serves to group shared access signatures and to provide additional restrictions for signatures that are bound by the policy.
trans-unit.target: Establishing a stored access policy serves to group shared access signatures and to provide additional restrictions for signatures that are bound by the policy.

trans-unit.source: You can use a stored access policy to change the start time, expiry time, or permissions for a signature, or to revoke it after it has been issued.
trans-unit.target: You can use a stored access policy to change the start time, expiry time, or permissions for a signature, or to revoke it after it has been issued.

trans-unit.source: A stored access policy gives you greater control over shared access signatures you have released.
trans-unit.target: A stored access policy gives you greater control over shared access signatures you have released.

trans-unit.source: Instead of specifying the signature's lifetime and permissions on the URL, you can specify these parameters on a stored access policy that is stored on the container, file share, queue, or table that contains the resource being shared.
trans-unit.target: Instead of specifying the signature's lifetime and permissions on the URL, you can specify these parameters on a stored access policy that is stored on the container, file share, queue, or table that contains the resource being shared.

trans-unit.source: To change these parameters for one or more signatures, you can modify the stored access policy, rather than reissuing the signatures.
trans-unit.target: To change these parameters for one or more signatures, you can modify the stored access policy, rather than reissuing the signatures.

trans-unit.source: You can also quickly revoke the signature by modifying the stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: You can also quickly revoke the signature by modifying the stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose you have issued a shared access signature that's associated with a stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: For example, suppose you have issued a shared access signature that's associated with a stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: If you've specified the expiry time within the stored access policy, you can modify the access policy to extend the life of the signature, without having to reissue a new signature.
trans-unit.target: If you've specified the expiry time within the stored access policy, you can modify the access policy to extend the life of the signature, without having to reissue a new signature.

trans-unit.source: Best practices recommend specifying a stored access policy for any signed resource for which you are issuing a shared access signature, as the stored policy can be used to modify or revoke the signature after it has been issued.
trans-unit.target: Best practices recommend specifying a stored access policy for any signed resource for which you are issuing a shared access signature, as the stored policy can be used to modify or revoke the signature after it has been issued.

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a stored policy, it's recommended that you limit the lifetime of your signature in order to minimize any risk to your storage account resources.
trans-unit.target: If you don't specify a stored policy, it's recommended that you limit the lifetime of your signature in order to minimize any risk to your storage account resources.

trans-unit.source: Associating a Shared Access Signature with a Stored Access Policy
trans-unit.target: Associating a Shared Access Signature with a Stored Access Policy

trans-unit.source: A stored access policy includes a name up to 64 characters long that is unique within the container, file share, queue, or table.
trans-unit.target: A stored access policy includes a name up to 64 characters long that is unique within the container, file share, queue, or table.

trans-unit.source: To associate a shared access signature with a stored access policy, you specify this identifier when creating the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: To associate a shared access signature with a stored access policy, you specify this identifier when creating the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: On the shared access signature URI, the signedidentifier field specifies the identifier for the stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: On the shared access signature URI, the signedidentifier field specifies the identifier for the stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: A container, file share, queue, or table can include up to 5 stored access policies.
trans-unit.target: A container, file share, queue, or table can include up to 5 stored access policies.

trans-unit.source: Each policy can be used by any number of shared access signatures.
trans-unit.target: Each policy can be used by any number of shared access signatures.

trans-unit.source: When you establish a stored access policy on a container, file share, queue, or table, it may take up to 30 seconds to take effect.
trans-unit.target: When you establish a stored access policy on a container, file share, queue, or table, it may take up to 30 seconds to take effect.

trans-unit.source: During this interval, a shared access signature that is associated with the stored access policy will fail with status code 403 (Forbidden), until the access policy becomes active.
trans-unit.target: During this interval, a shared access signature that is associated with the stored access policy will fail with status code 403 (Forbidden), until the access policy becomes active.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Access Policy Parameters for a Shared Access Policy
trans-unit.target: Specifying Access Policy Parameters for a Shared Access Policy

trans-unit.source: The stored access policy can specify the following access policy parameters for the signatures with which it's associated:
trans-unit.target: The stored access policy can specify the following access policy parameters for the signatures with which it's associated:

trans-unit.source: Depending on how you want to control access to your storage resource, you can specify all of these parameters within the stored access policy, and omit them from the URL for the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: Depending on how you want to control access to your storage resource, you can specify all of these parameters within the stored access policy, and omit them from the URL for the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Doing so permits you to modify the associated signature's behavior at any time, as well as to revoke it.
trans-unit.target: Doing so permits you to modify the associated signature's behavior at any time, as well as to revoke it.

trans-unit.source: Or you can specify one or more of the access policy parameters within the stored access policy, and the others on the URL.
trans-unit.target: Or you can specify one or more of the access policy parameters within the stored access policy, and the others on the URL.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you can specify all of the parameters on the URL.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you can specify all of the parameters on the URL.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you can use the stored access policy to revoke the signature, but not to modify its behavior.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you can use the stored access policy to revoke the signature, but not to modify its behavior.

trans-unit.source: Together the shared access signature and the stored access policy must include all fields required to authenticate the signature.
trans-unit.target: Together the shared access signature and the stored access policy must include all fields required to authenticate the signature.

trans-unit.source: If any required fields are missing, the request will fail with status code 403 (Forbidden).
trans-unit.target: If any required fields are missing, the request will fail with status code 403 (Forbidden).

trans-unit.source: Likewise, if a field is specified both in the shared access signature URL and in the stored access policy, the request will fail with status code 403 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: Likewise, if a field is specified both in the shared access signature URL and in the stored access policy, the request will fail with status code 403 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: See Create and Use a Shared Access Signature for more information about the fields that comprise the signature.
trans-unit.target: See Create and Use a Shared Access Signature for more information about the fields that comprise the signature.

trans-unit.source: Modifying or Revoking a Stored Access Policy
trans-unit.target: Modifying or Revoking a Stored Access Policy

trans-unit.source: To revoke access to shared access signatures that use the same stored access policy, remove the stored policy from the storage resource by overwriting the stored policy list with a new list that does not contain the policy name.
trans-unit.target: To revoke access to shared access signatures that use the same stored access policy, remove the stored policy from the storage resource by overwriting the stored policy list with a new list that does not contain the policy name.

trans-unit.source: To change access settings of a stored access policy, overwrite the stored policy list with a new list that contains a policy of the same name that has new access control details.
trans-unit.target: To change access settings of a stored access policy, overwrite the stored policy list with a new list that contains a policy of the same name that has new access control details.
